task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s one little solo-living win you’d add to your solo living exhibition?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s a skill or part of yourself you’d love to develop - maybe even through something at Abby?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: Your fave solo snack, worthy of the Abby gallery?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What adulting win belongs in your solo story?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: If procrastination was an art, what masterpiece would you contribute?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: If freedom had a snapshot in your solo-living exhibition, what moment would it show?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: If comfort was an artwork, what little solo ritual would you frame?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s one thing in your room or home that quietly says, ‘this is me’?
example: A photo wall of friends and travels

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s your solo-living soundtrack?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What would you tuck into your solo living story - something you miss?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What silly or proud ‘adulting’ badge would you display in your Abby solo-living exhibition?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: If you could turn one thing in your home into a museum object, what would it be and why?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: Have you ever had a moment in a museum that made you feel really seen or understood?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What tiny trace of you would you leave in Abby?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s a museum you’d love to visit one day, real or imaginary?

task: Guess the Corner
content: Make the other one guess by sketching or acting out your favourite spot at Abby’s.

task: Bomb Game
content:
Hit Start Timer, it’ll go off at a surprise moment.
Take turns sharing small solo-living wins.
When the bomb goes off, whoever’s turn it is… boom! The other person wins!

task: Charades
content: Act out one small win or proud moment you had today inside Abby.

task: Guess Solo Soundtrack
content: Write a song lyric that fits your solo vibe, your teammate guesses the song.

task: The “Un-Plan” Plan
content: Together make an “un-plan” exhibition: list the things you’d love not to have to do again.

task: Mini Myth-Making
content: You just became roomies in a imaginary building. Invent a fun backstory for your new home. Draw or write your shared myth.
example: Why does the hallway smell like cinnamon?

task: Solo living anthem
content: Together make your solo living anthem about chores you’re sick of. Then read it out loud together!
example: I am the lone warrior of laundry…

task: Fake Tour
content: Pick an object and give a confident, made-up tour.The other asks curious questions. Then switch!
example: So this stool is 100 years old...

task: The “Oops” Generator
content: Click the button to get a random item. Share a funny “oops” solo living moment involving it.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What object in your home have you used in a way it wasn’t meant to be used?

extra.title: The Living by Rinus Van de Velde
extra.description: Every chair, plant, and table is recreated in cardboard and paint. Abby invites you to step into Rinus Van de Velde’s world. Is it still art if you can touch and sit on it?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s something you brought with you from your “old home”?

extra.title: Two Roman Dog Skulls
extra.description: Two tiny Roman dog skulls sit casually on a shop shelf - once uncovered by archaeologists, now back guarding their old home.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What natural sounds do you associate with your solo-living experience?

extra.title: Bird Ritual
extra.description: What natural sounds do you associate with your solo-living experience?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s a habit you took from the people you lived with?

extra.title: Cuckoo Ritual
extra.description: Cuckoos leave their eggs in other nests. As adults, the chicks may cross paths and somehow recognise each other, reconnecting with a shared culture they never knew.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s would you like to change in ur solo living routine?

extra.title: Mirror of Perspectives
extra.description: A mirror made of different materials, reflecting shifting views - just like us, always changing, always seeing the world (and ourselves) from new angles.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: Describe the fantasy spaces you used to diy as a kid?
example: Stacking pillows for my cloud ship

extra.title: Tent of Sheets
extra.description: One artist built a tent from old sheets, just like in childhood, to prepare the space for their video. A playful, nostalgic touch inviting you to step inside and watch.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What is an independent person for you?
example: Someone who dares to do things their own way

extra.title: Outsider Artists
extra.description: Abby showcases outsider artists, creators beyond the traditional art world, sparking the question: What is art? Who gets to be called an artist?

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: How did you modify your old rituals?
example: Used to write before bed, now I leave voice notes

extra.title: Playing with Dimensions
extra.description: A vanguard art movement once flattened 3D scenes into playful 2D space. At Abby, you’ll see this - in both past paintings and today’s artists still experimenting with that spirit.

task:
Ask this question 
to your team mate:
content: What’s the difference between how people perceive you? And who u truly are?
example: People say I’m confident, but I’m actually overthink a lot

extra.title: Mirrored Stories
extra.description: One artist showed a mischievous gypsy woman; another, from a gypsy family, mirrored it with her own family simply playing cards revealing how stereotypes mask ordinary life.

task: Abby’s Backpack
content: Out of all these 10 items keep only 3 to help Abby solo live:

task: Write a note
content: Take a note from the jar. Leave one behind to cheer on the next solo-living explorer. Talk about the notes.
example: Share a tiny tip that helped you on tough days

task: Exquisite Corpse
content: Draw your “old self” together. Each person draws one body part (e.g., head) in a fold, without seeing the rest of the body. Unfold to reveal a weird, wonderful version of you.

task: Write and Plant
content: Write a wish on the seed paper. Plant it in the garden with an Abby helper nearby.
